Class Google::Map
In: slices/google_maps/google/map.rb
Parent: MapObject

Represents a map. If a method or event is not documented here please see googles online docs for details. See MapObject#listen_to on how to use events not listed on this object.

You will most likely use click, open_info_window, add_line, add_marker and add_markers to get some basic functionality going.

Examples:

 Google::Map.new # On the mushroom dotted plains of Afffrrrricaaaaa!

 Google::Map.new :center => :best_fit

 Google::Map.new :zoom => 8

 Google::Map.new(:center => {:latitude => -33.947, :longitude => 18.462})

 Google::Map.new(:center => {:latitude => -33.947, :longitude => 18.462},
                 :controls => [:small_map, :map_type])

 Google::Map.new(:center => {:latitude => -33.947, :longitude => 18.462},
                 :controls => [:small_map, :map_type],
                 :zoom => 12)

 Google::Map.new(:center => {:latitude => -33.947, :longitude => 18.462},
                 :controls => [:small_map, :overview_map],
                 :zoom => 12,
                 :type => :satellite)

Using the click event:

 # When the map is clicked, add a marker and open an info window at that location
 map.click do |script, location|
   map.add_marker :location => location
   map.open_info_window :location => location, :text => 'Awesome, you added a marker!'
 end

Adding markers using add_marker:

 map.add_marker :location => {:latitude => -34, :longitude => 18.5}

 map.add_marker :location => {:latitude => -34, :longitude => 18.5},
                :draggable => true,
                :title => "This is a marker!"

 map.add_marker :location => {:latitude => -34, :longitude => 18.5},
                :icon => :green_circle

Info windows using open_info_window:

 # At a specific location
 map.open_info_window :location => {:latitude => -34, :longitude => 18.5},
                      :text => 'Hello there...'

 # In the center of the map
 map.open_info_window :location => :center, :text => 'Hello there...'

 # Now using partial
 map.open_info_window :location => :center, :partial => 'spot_information',

 map.open_info_window :location => :center, :partial => 'spot_information', :locals => {:information => information}

 # Using a url, will include the location info in the url
 # Use params[:location] or params[:location][:latitude] and params[:location][:longitude] in your action
 map.open_info_window :locals => :center, :url => {:controller => :spot, :action => :show, :id => @spot}

 # Don't include the location in the params
 map.open_info_window :locals => :center, :url => {:controller => :spot, :action => :show, :id => @spot},
                      :include_location => false

Using lines with add_line

 map.add_line :vertices => [{:latitude => -33.958, :longitude => 18.462},
                            {:latitude => -33.987, :longitude => 18.462},
                            {:latitude => -33.999, :longitude => 18.472}]

 map.add_line :from => {:latitude => -33.958, :longitude => 18.462},
              :to => {:latitude => -33.987, :longitude => 18.462}

 map.add_line :from => {:latitude => -33.958, :longitude => 18.462},
              :to => {:latitude => -33.987, :longitude => 18.462},
              :colour => 'red', :thickness => 20

 # Adding a line betweem markers
 markers = map.add_markers({:location => {:latitude => -33.958, :longitude => 18.462}},
                           {:location => {:latitude => -33.987, :longitude => 18.462}},
                           {:location => {:latitude => -33.999, :longitude => 18.472}})

 map.add_line :between_markers => markers, :colour => 'red', :thickness => 10

Methods

add_circle   add_control   add_kml   add_line   add_marker   add_markers   add_pane   add_polygon   center   center=   change_marker   clear   click   controls=   extend_track_bounds   last_mouse_location   mouse_over   new   open_info_window   remove_line   remove_lines!   remove_marker   remove_overlay   remove_polygon   remove_type   replace_marker   show_blowup   type=   update_info_window   zoom=  

Constants

Control_types = [:small_map, :large_map, :small_zoom, :large_map_3D, :small_zoom_3D, :scale, :map_type, :menu_map_type, :hierarchical_map_type, :overview_map]
Map_types = [:normal, :satellite, :hybrid]

Attributes

type  [R] 
zoom  [R] 

Public Class methods

new(options = {})

Options:

  • center - Optional. Centers the map at this location defaulted to :best_fit, see center= for valid options.
  • controls - Optional. Which controls will be added to the map, see Control_types for valid controls.
  • zoom - Optional. The zoom level of the map defaulted to :best_fit, see zoom=.
  • type - Optional. The type of map, see type=.
  • keyboard_navigation - Optional. Indicates if keyboad navigation should be enabled, defaulted to false.

[Source]

     # File slices/google_maps/google/map.rb, line 107
107:     def initialize(options = {})
108:       options.default! :var => 'map', :center => :best_fit, :zoom => :best_fit,
109:                        :keyboard_navigation => false
110: 
111:       super
112: 
113:       options.assert_valid_keys :center, :controls, :zoom, :type, :keyboard_navigation
114: 
115:       if self.create_var?
116:         Google::Scripts.before_map_script << "var map;" # For IE Fix
117: 
118:         script << "map_lines = new Array();"
119:         script << "#{self.var} = new GMap2(document.getElementById('#{self.var}'));" 
120: 
121:         self.track_bounds!
122: 
123:         self.center = options.extract(:center)
124:         self.zoom = options.extract(:zoom)        
125:         self.enable_keyboard_navigation! if options.extract(:keyboard_navigation)
126:         
127:         self.track_last_mouse_location!
128:         
129:         self.options_to_fields options
130:       end
131:     end

Adds a circle to the map which can be a Circle or whatever Circle#new supports.

add_control(control, options = {})

Adds the control to the map, see Control_types of valid controls.

Options:

  • position - Optional. The position that the control should be placed.

Examples:

 map.add_control :small_zoom
 map.add_control Google::Pane.new(:text => 'This is a pane')
 map.add_control :small_zoom, :position => {:anchor => :top_right}
 map.add_control :map_type, :position => {:anchor => :top_left}
 map.add_control :map_type, :position => {:anchor => :top_left, :offset => [10, 10]}

[Source]

     # File slices/google_maps/google/map.rb, line 213
213:     def add_control(control, options = {})
214:       control = "new #{control.to_google_control}()" if control.is_a?(Symbol)
215:       position = Google::OptionsHelper.to_google_position options[:position]
216:       arguments = [control, position].compact
217: 
218:       script << "#{self.var}.addControl(#{arguments.join(', ')});"
219:     end

add_line(line)

Adds a line to the map which can be a Line or whatever Line#new supports.

Examples:

 map.add_line :vertices => [{:latitude => -33.958, :longitude => 18.462},
                            {:latitude => -33.987, :longitude => 18.462},
                            {:latitude => -33.999, :longitude => 18.472}]

 map.add_line :from => {:latitude => -33.958, :longitude => 18.462},
              :to => {:latitude => -33.987, :longitude => 18.462}

 map.add_line :from => {:latitude => -33.958, :longitude => 18.462},
              :to => {:latitude => -33.987, :longitude => 18.462},
              :colour => 'red', :thickness => 20

 # Adding a line betweem markers
 markers = map.add_markers({:location => {:latitude => -33.958, :longitude => 18.462}},
                           {:location => {:latitude => -33.987, :longitude => 18.462}},
                           {:location => {:latitude => -33.999, :longitude => 18.472}})

 map.add_line :between_markers => markers, :colour => 'red', :thickness => 10

[Source]

     # File slices/google_maps/google/map.rb, line 315

317: 
318:       self.add_overlay line
319:       line.added_to_map self
320:

322:       
323:       unless line.encoded?
324:         self.extend_track_bounds line.vertices
325:       end
326:

328:     end

Adds a single marker to the map which can be a Marker or whatever Marker#new supports.

Examples:

 map.add_marker :location => {:latitude => -34, :longitude => 18.5}

 map.add_marker :location => {:latitude => -34, :longitude => 18.5},
                :draggable => true,
                :title => "This is a marker!"

 map.add_marker :location => {:latitude => -34, :longitude => 18.5},
                :icon => :green_circle

center=(location)

Centers the map at the given location which can be :best_fit, a Location or whatever Location#new supports. If set to :best_fit google maps will determine an appropriate center location.

Examples:

 map.center = :best_fit

 map.center = {:latitude => -34, :longitude => 18.5}

 map.center = Google::Location.new(:latitude => -34, :longitude => 18.5)

[Source]

     # File slices/google_maps/google/map.rb, line 163
163:     def center=(location)
164:       location = Google::OptionsHelper.to_location(location)
165: 
166:       if location == :best_fit
167:         self.center = self.default_center
168:         Google::Scripts.end_of_map_script << "if(!track_bounds.isEmpty()){
169:                                                 #{self}.setCenter(track_bounds.getCenter()); 
170:                                               }".strip_each_line!
171:       else
172:         self.set_center location
173:       end
174:     end

click(info_window_options = nil) {|script, location| ...}

If called with a block it will attach the block to the "click" event of the map. If info_window_options are supplied an info window will be opened with those options and the block will be ignored.

This will only run if the map is clicked, not an info window or overlay.

Yields:

  • script - A JavaScriptGenerator to assist in generating javascript or interacting with the DOM.
  • location - The location at which the map was clicked.

Examples:

 # When the map is clicked, add a marker and open an info window at that location
 map.click do |script, location|
   map.add_marker :location => location
   map.open_info_window :location => location, :text => 'Awesome, you added a marker!'
 end

 # Using the +info_window_options+ convenience
 map.click :text => 'Awesome, an info window popped up!'

[Source]

     # File slices/google_maps/google/map.rb, line 409
409:     def click(info_window_options = nil)
410:       if info_window_options
411:         self.click do |script, location|
412:           self.open_info_window info_window_options.merge(:location => location)
413:         end
414:       elsif block_given?
415:         self.listen_to :event => :click, :with => [:overlay, :location] do |script, overlay, location|
416:           script << "if(location){"
417: 
418:           yield script, location
419: 
420:           script << "}"
421:         end
422:       end
423:     end
controls=(*controls)

Adds a control or controls to the map, see Control_types of valid controls. The controls will all be placed at their default positions, if you need control over the position use add_control.

Examples:

 map.controls = :small_zoom
 map.controls = :small_zoom, :map_type
 map.controls = :small_zoom, Google::Pane.new(:text => 'This is a pane')

[Source]

     # File slices/google_maps/google/map.rb, line 233
233:     def controls=(*controls)
234:       controls.flatten.each do |control|
235:         self.add_control control
236:       end
237:     end
extend_track_bounds(*locations)

Extends the tracking bounds of the map, locations added here will effect center and zoom if these are in best_fit mode.

Marker and Line objects are automatically tracked when using add_marker and add_line.

[Source]

     # File slices/google_maps/google/map.rb, line 496
496:     def extend_track_bounds(*locations)
497:       locations.flatten.each do |location|
498:         self << "track_bounds.extend(#{location});"
499:       end
500:     end
last_mouse_location()

The last location of the mouse. If the mouse has not moved the map center will be used.

mouse_over(&block)

This event is fired when the mouse "moves over" the map.

Yields:

  • script - A JavaScriptGenerator to assist in generating javascript or interacting with the DOM.
  • location - The location at which the mouse cursor is hovering.

[Source]

     # File slices/google_maps/google/map.rb, line 430
430:     def mouse_over(&block)
431:       self.listen_to :event => :mousemove, :with => :location, &block
432:     end
open_info_window(options)

Opens an info window on the map at the given location using either url, partial or text options as content.

Options:

  • location - Optional. A Location, whatever Location#new supports or :center which indicates where the info window must be placed on the map, defaulted to center.
  • url - Optional. URL is generated by rails url_for. Supports standard url arguments and javascript variable interpolation.
  • include_location - Optional. Works in conjunction with the url option and indicates if latitude and longitude parameters of location should be sent through with the url, defaulted to true. Use params[:location] or params[:location][:latitude] and params[:location][:longitude] in your action.
  • partial - Optional. Supports the same form as rails render for partials, content of the rendered partial will be placed inside the info window.
  • text - Optional. The html content that will be placed inside the info window.

Examples:

 # At a specific location
 map.open_info_window :location => {:latitude => -34, :longitude => 18.5},
                      :text => 'Hello there...'

 # In the center of the map
 map.open_info_window :location => :center, :text => 'Hello there...'

 # Now using partial
 map.open_info_window :location => :center, :partial => 'spot_information',

 map.open_info_window :location => :center, :partial => 'spot_information', :locals => {:information => information}

 # Using a url, will include the location info in the url
 # Use params[:location] or params[:location][:latitude] and params[:location][:longitude] in your action
 map.open_info_window :locals => :center, :url => {:controller => :spot, :action => :show, :id => @spot}

 # Don't include the location in the params
 map.open_info_window :locals => :center, :url => {:controller => :spot, :action => :show, :id => @spot},
                      :include_location => false

[Source]

     # File slices/google_maps/google/map.rb, line 467
467:     def open_info_window(options)
468:       info_window = InfoWindow.new(:object => self)
469:       info_window.open options
470:     end

remove_type(*types)

Removes map types from the map, see Map_types of valid map types.

Examples:

  map.remove_type :satellite
  map.remove_type :normal, :satellite

[Source]

     # File slices/google_maps/google/map.rb, line 148
148:     def remove_type(*types)
149:       types.each do |type|
150:         self.remove_map_type type.to_map_type
151:       end

show_blowup(options = {})

Opens an info window at the given location that contains a blowup view of the map around the location.

Options:

  • location - Required. The location at which the the blowup must be placed.
  • zoom_level - Optional. Sets the blowup to a particular zoom level.
  • map_type - Optional. Set the type of map shown in the blowup.

[Source]

     # File slices/google_maps/google/map.rb, line 485
485:     def show_blowup(options = {})
486:       options[:map_type] = options[:map_type].to_map_type if options[:map_type]
487:       location = Google::OptionsHelper.to_location(options.extract(:location))
488:       
489:       self << "#{self.var}.showMapBlowup(#{location}, #{options.to_google_options});" 
490:     end
type=(value)

Sets the type of map to display, see Map_types of valid map types.

Examples:

 map.type = :satellite
 map.type = :hybrid

Updates the contents of an existing info window. This supports the relevant content options of open_info_window.

475:

zoom=(zoom)

Sets the zoom level of the map, zoom can be a number(1 - 22) or :best_fit. If set to :best_fit google maps will determine an appropriate zoom level.

Examples:

 map.zoom = :best_fit

 map.zoom = 12

[Source]

     # File slices/google_maps/google/map.rb, line 192
192:     def zoom=(zoom)
193:       @zoom = zoom
194: 
195:       if zoom == :best_fit
196:         Google::Scripts.end_of_map_script << "#{self}.setZoom(#{self}.getBoundsZoomLevel(track_bounds));"
197:       else
198:         self.set_zoom(self.zoom)        
199:       end
200:     end
